page.title: 09Local Festivals & Customs
page.content: Some customs such as wearing a sprig of oak on Oak Apple Day and celeb_ rating Cattern have died out, but events connected with the church are still celebrated regularly. The Harvest Festival is held each year and followed by a Harvest Supper - usually at the Barn. The September Fete is held at Hinwick House followed by a supper - sometimes at school. The Shaftesbury Society hold a fete in June/July followed by a mini fete in the winter months. The school mini market is a popular annual event as is the school Carol Concert and Nativity Play held by tradition in the church. School concerts and sports are supported by the village. The Queen's Silver Jubilee was celebrated with a day of pageantry and feasting.
